title: Genesis Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Genesis chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Genesis Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Genesis Chapter 17.

questions.question: How old was Abram when the LORD appeared to him and spoke in Genesis 17?
questions.correctAnswer: 99 years old
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:1 states Abram was ninety years old and nine when the LORD appeared to him.

questions.question: What new name did God give to Abram in Genesis 17?
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:5 says God changed Abram's name to Abraham because he would be a father of many nations.

questions.question: What was the sign of the covenant that God commanded Abraham and his descendants to keep?
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcision
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:10-11 declares circumcision as the token of the covenant between God and Abraham's descendants.

questions.question: At what age should a male child be circumcised according to God’s command in Genesis 17?
questions.correctAnswer: At eight days old
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:12 specifies that every male child shall be circumcised when he is eight days old.

questions.question: What did God say would happen to an uncircumcised male child who breaks the covenant?
options: He shall be cut off from his people
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be cut off from his people
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:14 states that an uncircumcised male child shall be cut off from his people for breaking the covenant.

questions.question: What new name did God give to Sarai, Abraham's wife?
questions.correctAnswer: Sarah
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:15 mentions God changed Sarai's name to Sarah.

questions.question: Who did God promise would be born to Sarah as a son?
questions.correctAnswer: Isaac
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:19 reveals that Sarah shall bear Abraham a son named Isaac.

questions.question: What was Abraham’s reaction when God told him Sarah would bear a son?
questions.correctAnswer: He laughed
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:17 states Abraham laughed and questioned how a child could be born to him at his old age.

questions.question: How old was Ishmael when he was circumcised?
questions.correctAnswer: 13 years old
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:25 states Ishmael was thirteen years old when circumcised.

questions.question: True or False: God promised to multiply Ishmael exceedingly and make him a great nation.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:20 describes God blessing Ishmael to be fruitful, multiplying him exceedingly and making him a great nation.

questions.question: True or False: Abraham circumcised only himself and Isaac on the same day as commanded by God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:23 and 17:27 show Abraham circumcised Ishmael and all the males in his house that day, not just himself and Isaac.

questions.question: True or False: God’s covenant with Abraham and his seed was to be an everlasting covenant.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:7 states that God’s covenant with Abraham and his seed is an everlasting covenant.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Genesis 17:8: 'And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a ________, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession...'
questions.correctAnswer: stranger
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:8 says the land where Abraham was a stranger will be given to him and his seed.

questions.question: What did God say Abraham should do to walk before Him and be perfect?
questions.correctAnswer: Walk before Him
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:1 records God telling Abram to walk before Him and be perfect.

questions.question: Who did Abraham ask God about, saying 'O that he might live before thee'?
questions.correctAnswer: Ishmael
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:18 shows Abraham asking God about Ishmael's future.

medium.title: Genesis Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Genesis Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubts about God's promises due to old age. Based on Genesis 17, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God is faithful and keeps His covenant regardless of our age
Promises depend on our strength and youth
Doubt is the natural response to long waiting
God changes His mind according to circumstances
questions.correctAnswer: God is faithful and keeps His covenant regardless of our age
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:1-2, 17-19 show God's covenant to Abraham at age 99 and Sarah at 90, promising a son despite their old age, highlighting God's faithfulness beyond human limitations.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 teach us about obedience in our relationship with God?
options: By instructing Abraham to circumcise himself and his household as a sign of the covenant
By allowing Abraham to choose which commands to follow
By emphasizing only internal faith without outward actions
By suggesting that obedience is optional when difficult
questions.correctAnswer: By instructing Abraham to circumcise himself and his household as a sign of the covenant
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:9-14 commands Abraham and his descendants to keep the covenant through circumcision, demonstrating obedience through concrete action.

questions.question: What does Genesis 17 reveal about God’s faithfulness in family and generational blessings?
options: God establishes His covenant not only with Abraham but also with his seed for generations
God’s blessings stop with the first generation
Only Abraham personally receives blessings without impact on family
Generational blessings depend on human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: God establishes His covenant not only with Abraham but also with his seed for generations
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 emphasize God's covenant as everlasting with Abraham and his descendants, promising land and being their God across generations.

questions.question: A believer is questioning how to maintain spiritual discipline in daily life. What principle from Genesis 17 can you share?
options: Consistent obedience to God's commands, such as circumcision, serves as a physical and spiritual reminder of the covenant
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary if one has faith
Discipline depends on feelings rather than commitment
Only outward rituals matter, not the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Consistent obedience to God's commands, such as circumcision, serves as a physical and spiritual reminder of the covenant
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:10-11 teaches that circumcision is a lasting token of God's covenant, encouraging disciplined and faithful observance.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 encourage humility and trust in God when facing seemingly impossible situations?
options: Abraham laughs but still obeys God, showing trust despite doubts
Abraham rejects God's promise due to his age
God requires perfect understanding before faith
Trust depends solely on human reasoning
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham laughs but still obeys God, showing trust despite doubts
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:17-18 records Abraham’s laughter at the promise but he continues in conversation and obedience, demonstrating humility and trust.

questions.question: What lesson about God’s covenant relationship can we learn from Genesis 17 regarding personal holiness and community?
options: The covenant is marked by physical signs affecting not only the individual but the entire household
Covenant is a private matter with no community impact
Holiness is unrelated to covenant observance
Community has no role in individual spiritual commitments
questions.correctAnswer: The covenant is marked by physical signs affecting not only the individual but the entire household
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:23-27 shows Abraham circumcising all males in his household, emphasizing communal obedience and holiness as part of covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 exemplify the importance of names and identity in God’s plan?
options: God changes Abram’s and Sarai’s names to Abraham and Sarah to signify their new roles in His covenant
Human identity is fixed and unchangeable
God accepts only original names without change
questions.correctAnswer: God changes Abram’s and Sarai’s names to Abraham and Sarah to signify their new roles in His covenant
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:5,15 shows God renaming Abram and Sarai to Abraham and Sarah, indicating their calling as father and mother of nations.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 17, circumcision was required only for those born into Abraham’s family, not for any outsiders.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:12-13 clarifies that circumcision was required for every male child born in the house or bought with money from any stranger, not just descendants.

questions.question: True or False: Genesis 17 teaches that breaking God’s covenant, such as not being circumcised, results in being cut off from the people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:14 states that the uncircumcised man child shall be cut off from his people for breaking the covenant.

questions.question: A believer is confused about God’s promises to Ishmael and Isaac. Based on Genesis 17, how would you explain God’s plan?
options: God blesses Ishmael and makes him a great nation, but establishes His covenant with Isaac and his descendants
God rejects Ishmael completely and only blesses Isaac
Both Ishmael and Isaac receive the same covenant promises
God’s promises depend solely on human effort
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses Ishmael and makes him a great nation, but establishes His covenant with Isaac and his descendants
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:20-21 explains God’s blessing on Ishmael to be fruitful and a great nation, but His covenant is established with Isaac.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 teach about stewardship and the responsibility of believers toward their households?
options: Abraham circumcised all males in his household promptly, showing responsible spiritual leadership
Spiritual duties apply only to the individual, not the household
Household members are free to choose their own spiritual path without guidance
Stewardship is only about material possessions, not spiritual discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham circumcised all males in his household promptly, showing responsible spiritual leadership
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:23-27 illustrates Abraham’s immediate obedience in circumcising all males in his household, reflecting faithful stewardship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Genesis 17, God calls Abraham to be a ______ of many nations.
questions.correctAnswer: father
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:4-5 states God’s covenant that Abraham shall be a father of many nations.

questions.question: Based on Genesis 17, how can believers find contentment and gratitude in God’s promises?
options: By trusting God’s everlasting covenant and His faithfulness to provide blessings in His timing
By demanding immediate fulfillment of promises
By relying on their own plans rather than God’s promises
By comparing their blessings with others
questions.correctAnswer: By trusting God’s everlasting covenant and His faithfulness to provide blessings in His timing
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:7-8, 21 show God's covenant is everlasting and will be fulfilled in the set time, encouraging trust and gratitude.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 encourage believers to persevere through trials and uncertainty?
options: By demonstrating Abraham’s faith and obedience despite his and Sarah’s old age
By promising a life without difficulties
By instructing believers to give up if trials persist
By relying solely on human wisdom to solve problems
questions.correctAnswer: By demonstrating Abraham’s faith and obedience despite his and Sarah’s old age
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:1,17-18 show Abraham’s acceptance of God’s promise and continued obedience even when circumstances seemed impossible.

questions.question: What spiritual lesson about marriage and partnership is taught in Genesis 17?
options: God renames Sarah and blesses her to be a mother of nations, showing marriage as part of God’s covenant plan
Marriage is merely a social contract without spiritual significance
Only Abraham is important in God’s plan, not Sarah
Blessings come independently of marital relationships
questions.correctAnswer: God renames Sarah and blesses her to be a mother of nations, showing marriage as part of God’s covenant plan
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:15-16 records God changing Sarai’s name to Sarah and blessing her to bear a son, affirming marriage’s role in God’s purposes.

hard.title: Genesis Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Genesis Chapter 17.

questions.question: What significant change in Abram's identity is declared by God in Genesis 17, and what does it signify?
options: Abram's name is changed to Abraham, signifying he will be the father of many nations
Abram's name is changed to Isaac, signifying the promised son
Abram's name is changed to Ishmael, signifying a fruitful nation
Abram's name remains the same, but his descendants will be kings
questions.correctAnswer: Abram's name is changed to Abraham, signifying he will be the father of many nations
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:5 states God changed Abram's name to Abraham, indicating his role as father of many nations, highlighting a covenantal identity shift.

questions.question: How does Genesis 17 establish the practice of circumcision, and what is its theological significance?
options: Circumcision is commanded as a physical sign of the covenant between God and Abraham's descendants
Circumcision is a ritual for purification from sin
Circumcision is a symbolic act representing resurrection
Circumcision is only for priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcision is commanded as a physical sign of the covenant between God and Abraham's descendants
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:10-11 prescribes circumcision as a covenant sign, symbolizing the everlasting agreement between God and Abraham's seed.

questions.question: In the context of ancient Near Eastern covenant practices, what does God's promise to Abraham about the land of Canaan symbolize in Genesis 17:8?
options: An everlasting possession and divine blessing for Abraham's descendants
Temporary settlement until a permanent homeland is found
A conditional grant based on Abraham's obedience alone
A symbolic reference to spiritual inheritance only
questions.correctAnswer: An everlasting possession and divine blessing for Abraham's descendants
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:8 promises Abraham and his descendants the land of Canaan as an eternal possession, reflecting a foundational promise for Israel's identity and history.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in God's dialogue with Abraham in Genesis 17 to emphasize the covenant's perpetuity?
options: Chiasm between Abraham and his seed
questions.correctAnswer: Repetition of the term 'everlasting covenant'
questions.explanation: The phrase 'everlasting covenant' is repeated in verses 7, 13, and 19 to emphasize the eternal nature of God's promise to Abraham and his descendants.

questions.question: What is the significance of the age specified for circumcision in Genesis 17:12 within the cultural and medical context of the ancient Near East?
options: Eight days old, aligning with infant health practices and covenant initiation
At birth, to ensure immediate inclusion in the covenant
At puberty, marking maturity and responsibility
Only adult men are circumcised as a sign of commitment
questions.correctAnswer: Eight days old, aligning with infant health practices and covenant initiation
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:12 mandates circumcision on the eighth day, which coincides with ancient medical wisdom regarding blood clotting and symbolizes covenant entry at infancy.

questions.question: How does Abraham's reaction to God's promise about Sarah's future son reflect a theme of faith and doubt in Genesis 17?
options: He laughs upon hearing that Sarah will bear a child at an old age
He protests the promise with anger
He requests an alternative son immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He laughs upon hearing that Sarah will bear a child at an old age
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:17 records Abraham's laughter expressing amazement and doubt, a motif echoed later in Scripture illustrating human response to divine promises.

questions.question: What is the role of the name 'Isaac' in the covenantal promises of Genesis 17, and how does it contrast with Ishmael?
options: Isaac is the child of promise through Sarah; covenant established with him, while Ishmael is blessed but not the primary heir
Isaac is a servant; Ishmael is the true heir of the covenant
Both Isaac and Ishmael share equal covenant status
Isaac is a symbolic name with no real descendant significance
questions.correctAnswer: Isaac is the child of promise through Sarah; covenant established with him, while Ishmael is blessed but not the primary heir
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:19-21 distinguishes Isaac as the covenant son deriving from Sarah, while Ishmael is blessed but not the covenant heir, reflecting covenantal election.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 17, the covenant with Abraham is limited only to his natural descendants and excludes any strangers in his household.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:12-13 includes those born in Abraham’s house and those bought with money from strangers, showing the covenant extends to all males in his household through circumcision.

questions.question: What does the term 'walk before me, and be thou perfect' in Genesis 17:1 imply about the nature of Abraham's relationship with God?
options: It calls for a life of obedience and moral integrity in God's presence
It commands Abraham to physically follow God everywhere
It suggests Abraham must perform sacrifices daily
It means Abraham must be flawless in every action
questions.correctAnswer: It calls for a life of obedience and moral integrity in God's presence
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:1 uses 'walk before me, and be thou perfect' metaphorically to urge Abraham to live in faithful obedience and integrity before God.

questions.question: How does the covenant in Genesis 17 serve as a foreshadowing of New Testament themes of covenant and promise?
options: It prefigures the new covenant through faith and the inclusion of all nations
It is exclusively about land possession with no spiritual implications
It predicts the Mosaic Law exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures the new covenant through faith and the inclusion of all nations
questions.explanation: The promise of many nations and an everlasting covenant in Genesis 17 anticipates the New Testament's expansion of God's blessing to Gentiles through faith (e.g., Romans 4).

questions.question: What cultural or legal significance does the punishment for uncircumcision described in Genesis 17:14 hold in the ancient Near Eastern context?
options: Being cut off from the people signifies exclusion from the covenant community and social death
It implies physical death by execution
It means exile to a foreign land
It indicates loss of property but retention of community ties
questions.correctAnswer: Being cut off from the people signifies exclusion from the covenant community and social death
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:14 states the uncircumcised male shall be cut off, meaning expulsion from the covenant community, a severe social and religious penalty in the ancient world.

questions.question: How does the immediate obedience of Abraham to circumcise himself and all males in his household (Genesis 17:23-27) reflect the covenantal theme of faith and action?
options: It demonstrates that covenant faith requires prompt and tangible obedience
It shows Abraham's doubt and hesitation
It reflects a purely symbolic act with no real importance
It was delayed until Isaac’s birth
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates that covenant faith requires prompt and tangible obedience
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:23-27 records Abraham's immediate compliance, underscoring the biblical theme that faith is evidenced by action in covenant relationships.

questions.question: What is the significance of God's self-identification as 'the Almighty God' (El Shaddai) in Genesis 17:1 within the covenant context?
options: It emphasizes God's power to fulfill His promises despite human limitations
It is a mere title with no covenantal importance
It refers only to God's role as creator
It is a name used only during the patriarchal period
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's power to fulfill His promises despite human limitations
questions.explanation: In Genesis 17:1, El Shaddai underscores God's omnipotence, reassuring Abraham that despite age and barrenness, the covenant promises will be realized.

questions.question: Which kings or nations mentioned in later biblical texts trace their ancestry back to Abraham as promised in Genesis 17:6?
options: The kings of Israel and surrounding nations, including Edomites and Midianites
No nations trace back to Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: The kings of Israel and surrounding nations, including Edomites and Midianites
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:6 predicts kings from Abraham’s lineage; later texts identify Israelite kings and neighboring peoples like Edom and Midian as his descendants.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 17, Abraham was circumcised at age ninety-nine as a sign of his acceptance of God’s covenant.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:24 confirms Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised, marking his covenantal obedience.

theological.title: Genesis Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Genesis Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What name did God give to Abram to signify that he would be a father of many nations?
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham
questions.explanation: God changed Abram's name to Abraham to signify that he would be a father of many nations, as stated in Genesis 17:5. This name change reflects God's sovereign plan, consistent with other biblical instances of name changes indicating new purposes (e.g., Jacob to Israel in Genesis 32:28, Simon to Peter in Matthew 16:18).

questions.question: What is the sign of the covenant that God commanded Abraham and his descendants to keep?
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcision
questions.explanation: Circumcision is the sign of the covenant given in Genesis 17:10-11. This physical sign distinguished God's people and was a lasting token of their relationship with Him, paralleling signs of covenant faithfulness seen throughout Scripture (Exodus 12:48-49; Romans 4:11).

questions.question: At what age were male children to be circumcised according to God's covenant with Abraham?
questions.correctAnswer: Eight days old
questions.explanation: God commanded circumcision to be performed on every male child at eight days old (Genesis 17:12). This early age emphasizes the covenant's permanence and priority, symbolizing purification and consecration similar to the early dedication of Jesus in Luke 2:21.

questions.question: Which son did God establish as the heir of His everlasting covenant with Abraham?
questions.correctAnswer: Isaac
questions.explanation: God specifically established His covenant with Isaac, the son Sarah would bear, promising an everlasting covenant through him and his descendants (Genesis 17:19-21). This foreshadows the messianic line culminating in Christ, as affirmed in Romans 9:7-8.

questions.question: What did God promise to give Abraham and his descendants as an everlasting possession?
questions.correctAnswer: The land of Canaan
questions.explanation: God promised Abraham and his descendants the land of Canaan as an everlasting possession (Genesis 17:8). This promise is foundational for the biblical theme of the promised land, which prefigures the eternal inheritance for God's people in Hebrews 11:9-10.

questions.question: How did Abraham respond when God told him Sarah would bear a son in her old age?
questions.correctAnswer: He laughed
questions.explanation: Abraham laughed upon hearing that Sarah would bear a son at her advanced age (Genesis 17:17). This response reflects human incredulity in the face of divine promise, similar to Sarah’s laughter in Genesis 18:12, yet God’s power over nature fulfills His word (Luke 1:37).

questions.question: What consequence did God declare for any uncircumcised male who breaks the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Cut off from his people
questions.explanation: God declared that any uncircumcised male who breaks the covenant shall be cut off from his people (Genesis 17:14). This severe penalty underscores the holiness and seriousness of God's covenant, paralleling later Old Testament laws requiring separation for covenant unfaithfulness (Leviticus 7:20-21).

questions.question: What new name did God give to Sarai, Abraham's wife?
questions.correctAnswer: Sarah
questions.explanation: God changed Sarai's name to Sarah to signify her role as a mother of nations and kings (Genesis 17:15-16). This name change parallels divine initiatives marking new covenant roles, such as Jacob to Israel (Genesis 32:28), emphasizing God's sovereign plan.

questions.question: What did Abraham do immediately after God's covenant and command regarding circumcision?
options: He circumcised all the males in his house on the same day
He questioned God about the command
He left the land of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: He circumcised all the males in his house on the same day
questions.explanation: Abraham obeyed God's command and circumcised all the males in his house, including Ishmael and those born or bought, on the very same day (Genesis 17:23-27). This immediate obedience highlights faith and submission to God's covenant, exemplified elsewhere in Scripture (Exodus 12:48; Romans 4:12).

questions.question: What title does God use to introduce Himself to Abram in this chapter?
options: I am the Lord your God
I am the God of Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: I am the Almighty God
questions.explanation: God introduces Himself as 'I am the Almighty God' to Abram in Genesis 17:1, emphasizing His sovereign power to fulfill promises and establish covenant relationships, a theme consistent with God's self-revelation in Exodus 6:3 and Revelation 1:8.

questions.question: What did God promise concerning Ishmael, Abraham's son?
options: He will be blessed and become a great nation
He will inherit the covenant with Isaac
He will be excluded from God's promises
He will be the first king of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He will be blessed and become a great nation
questions.explanation: God promised to bless Ishmael, make him fruitful, multiply him exceedingly, and that twelve princes would come from him, making him a great nation (Genesis 17:20). This demonstrates God's justice and faithfulness even to those outside the covenant line, consistent with Romans 9:7-13.

questions.question: What does the covenant with Abraham reveal about God's faithfulness?
options: God establishes an everlasting covenant with Abraham and his descendants
God's promises are conditional on human perfection
questions.correctAnswer: God establishes an everlasting covenant with Abraham and his descendants
questions.explanation: The covenant is described as everlasting, extending to Abraham's seed through all generations (Genesis 17:7, 13). This reveals God's unchanging faithfulness and sovereign grace, a theme echoed in Psalm 105:8-10 and Hebrews 6:13-18.

questions.question: Which phrase best summarizes the ethical call God gave to Abram at the beginning of this chapter?
options: Walk before me, and be thou perfect
questions.correctAnswer: Walk before me, and be thou perfect
questions.explanation: God commanded Abram to 'walk before me, and be thou perfect' (Genesis 17:1), calling for a life of faithful obedience and holiness. This ethical demand parallels the call to holiness seen in Leviticus 19:2 and 1 Peter 1:16.

questions.question: How old was Abraham when he was circumcised as a sign of the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Ninety-nine years old
questions.explanation: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he underwent circumcision (Genesis 17:24). His willingness to submit to this sign at an advanced age illustrates faith and commitment, resonating with Romans 4:20-24 where faith is credited as righteousness.

questions.question: What does the covenant in Genesis 17 teach about God's relationship with Abraham's descendants?
options: God will be their God and establish an everlasting covenant
God will forsake them if they sin once
God will give them unconditional prosperity
God's covenant is only for Abraham alone
questions.correctAnswer: God will be their God and establish an everlasting covenant
questions.explanation: Genesis 17:7 and 17:8 emphasize that God will be the God of Abraham's descendants, establishing an everlasting covenant, indicating a perpetual relationship based on divine grace, consistent with Deuteronomy 7:9 and 2 Corinthians 1:20.
